intro: Paraboea nervosissima, commonly known as the hairy paraboea, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its erect, herbaceous stems and opposite, ovate leaves with prominent veins. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or white, arranged in clusters at the tips of the branches. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in tropical gardens.
